title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Monday, 18 January 2016 - BBC News
summary: two raf bases are to be sold off for housing , the government confirms .
cambridge city council is trying to introduce an order on punting touts .
an ely restaurant has been badly damaged after a diner drove into it .
more news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: our live coverage through the day
text: local live is finished for today but we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with all the latest news , weather , sport and travel for cambridgeshire .
have a good evening .

documents.title: weather : dry with long clear periods and high cloud
text: tonight it 's becoming very cold with a widespread , hard frost as temperatures fall as low as -7c ( 19f ) in some rural spots .
a cold , frosty but sunny and dry start to tuesday while feeling cold in a light northwesterly breeze .
maximum temperature : 4c ( 39f ) .
get more details on the forecast where you live from bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: football : st neots plan to appoint interim manager
text: st neots town owner lee kearns says he 's intending to appoint an interim manager as successor to david batch .
batch resigned on thursday , just over a year after joining the saints from sudbury .
st neots are currently 18th in the southern league premier division .
`` we want to find someone to get us through to the end of the season , at which point we 'll make a decision on next year . ''
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: air ambulance dedicated base opens at cambridge airport
text: a new dedicated helicopter pad and building for the east anglian air ambulance and its crew of pilots and administrators has opened at cambridge airport .
the service says it can now respond more quickly to emergency calls in its area covering bedfordshire , cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk .
the new building has a proper area to debrief crews after difficult jobs , and a large drugs and equipment store to give them more space to prepare for shifts , a spokesman said .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: news update : raf bases being sold off for housing striker pleased to make permanent move to the u 's
text: if you 're catching up :
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: tribute to fire service stalwart who died of heart attack
text: cambridgeshire fire and rescue has issued a tribute to whittlesey fireman malcolm bean , who died suddenly following a cardiac arrest at his home on thursday aged 57 .

he joined the service in june 1985 as an on-call firefighter at whittlesey , where watch commander mark brown said : `` malc had a great sense of humour , jovial character and an easy going manner , so his sudden death has been devastating to us all . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: two raf bases to be sold for housing , minister reveals
text: two raf bases in cambridgeshire occupied by the american air force until the late 1990s are among 12 being sold off for housing by the ministry of defence , to raise £ 500m .
the government has confirmed raf molesworth , where cruise missiles were based , and raf alconbury , from where special operations were carried out , will go on the market .

mark lancaster , minister for defence , personnel and veterans , said money raised from the disposal will be ploughed back into defence budgets and the sale of the 12 sites will provide land for around 15,000 new homes .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: harley davidson bike stolen from littleport garage sought
text: a modified harley davidson motorcycle worth £ 13,000 has been stolen from a garage in littleport .
in a bid to trace its whereabouts police have issued its registration as ae51kvz and said it was stolen from kingsmeads court on 11 january , between 17:00 and 19:00 .
sgt phil priestley said : `` the motorcycle is unique because of aftermarket modifications , including an alternative saddle .
the theft has had a significant impact on the victim - a motorcycle enthusiast . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: owner feels 'so sorry ' for driver who crashed into her restaurant
text: despite her restaurant being badly damaged after a car crashed into it , ann jarman , who runs the old fire engine house in ely , said she feels `` so sorry '' for the driver .
`` the family was coming in for a celebration lunch .
poor thing .
she was trying to park and i think her foot just slipped , '' she said .
the restaurant had to be closed but has now been boarded-up and it was `` business as usual '' for customers , she added .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: seven new charges for peterborough residents in care are approved
text: new charges for people receiving care in peterborough are coming into effect , with some people who refuse to sell their home expected to pay interest on the funds they receive .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: 'staff thought a bomb had gone off ' in restaurant car smash
text: an elderly woman trying to park outside a restaurant for a sunday lunch accidentally crashed into it .
as reported in the ely news , the smash happened at about 12:30 at the old fire engine house near ely cathedral .
restaurant owner ann jarman told the bbc `` staff thought a bomb had gone off '' .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: football : ben williamson 'delighted ' with cambridge united return
text: striker ben williamson ( he is pleased to have agreed a permanent deal with cambridge united , having enjoyed a successful loan spell at the abbey .
the 27-year-old has signed a contract which will keep him with the u 's until the summer of 2017 .
`` my aims are simple .
i just want to get in the team , stay in the team and put in good performances . ''
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: restaurant owner says 'miracle ' no-one hurt after crash
text: the owner of a restaurant that had a car drive into it said it was a `` miracle '' no-one was hurt .
`` if anyone had been in the room at the time i think they would have been pretty badly injured , '' said ann jarman , owner of the old fire engine house in ely .
she said the stainless steel work surfaces had been `` pushed right to the back against the fridges and there was glass everywhere '' .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: punt touts face ban from cambridge city centre
text: `` out of control '' touts `` hassling '' the public to take punt trips could be banned from a swathe of cambridge .
city council leader lewis herbert said introducing a public space protection order would make touting for customers illegal in areas away from the river cam , including king 's parade .
`` essentially you 've got groups of touts at each junction around the city centre , '' he said , branding them `` a hassle '' .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: ely news : over 600 people attend farewell service at ely cathedral for canon alan hargrave
text: more than 600 people attended a farewell service for canon alan hargrave at ely cathedral on sunday .

documents.title: weather : dry and bright this afternoon
text: this afternoon will be dry and bright and there may be one or two sunny spells around later .
winds will be light but it will still feel cold , with a maximum temperature of 4c ( 39f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: man in court after tractor chase in norfolk and cambridgeshire
text: a man from wisbech has appeared in court after a tractor was chased between two counties by six patrol cars and a force helicopter .
the vehicle was taken from a farm in tilney st lawrence , norfolk , on saturday before being abandoned in oakroyd crescent , wisbech , during the evening .

a 25-year-old man , from wisbech , who faces charges of aggravated vehicle taking , dangerous driving , failure to stop , and driving without insurance , was remanded in custody for the the case to be heard at norwich crown court next month .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: headlines : men jailed for cambridge stabbing man in court after tractor chase
text: here are the top stories making the news this afternoon :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: gum-flavoured e-cigarettes could attract children , says cambridge study
text: advertisements for chocolate and bubble gum-flavoured e-cigarettes could attract children to try vaping , according to new research in cambridge .
the research , carried out by the university of cambridge for the department of health , examined concerns that the use of e-cigarettes among children and adolescents could lead to tobacco smoking .
the study found school children shown adverts for candy-flavoured e-cigarettes expressed greater interest in buying and trying them than their peers .

documents.title: wallace and gromit creators produce dementia film for cambridge-based charity
text: the makers of wallace and gromit have produced a short film for a cambridgeshire-based charity alzheimer 's research uk to address people 's misconceptions about dementia .
it features former doctor who star christopher eccleston , whose father ronnie died following a 14-year battle with the illness .
eccleston , 51 , said he hoped it would `` fight the misunderstanding and fatalism that surrounds dementia '' .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: crash damages old fire engine house restaurant in ely
text: a car has crashed into the old fire engine house restaurant in ely .
the accident happened at about 12:30 on sunday when the car went off the road into the building in st mary 's street .
east of england ambulance service said the driver was uninjured and discharged at the scene .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: car crashes into old fire engine house restaurant in ely
text: a car crashed into the old fire engine house in ely - just moments after a member of staff had been in the restaurant 's food preparation room .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: photo of norman cross motel in historic archive
text: a photo of a distinctive motel near peterborough , thought to date from the 1970s , forms part of an archive of photographs being made available to the public .
the the norman cross motel on junction 16 of the a1 ( m ) /a15 which has now been incorporated into the premier inn on the site .

more than 3,000 charrington brewery photographs were rescued from a skip by robert humphreys , at the time an area manager for the brewery , and now willl be shared online by the national brewery heritage trust ( nbht ) .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: a few miles per hour over speed limit could leave 'a lifetime of heartache ' , says grieving wisbech family
text: drivers in cambridgeshire are being urged to slow down .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: move to ban cambridge punting touts
text: by the summer punting touts could be banned from much of cambridge city centre .
the council wants to introduce a public space protection order , making it illegal for touts to sell boat tours further than 50m from the river .
a decision will be made at a city council meeting tonight .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: city deal may pave the way for hourly buses in heart of cambridge
text: some 300 buses could be carrying more than 10,000 people into cambridge every hour if the city deal plan goes ahead - prompting fears of gridlock on the city 's inner ring road .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: arrest after man seen on rooftops of cambridge shops
text: a man has been arrested after a police pursuit of a suspect along the rooftops of shops in the centre of cambridge .
police , the force helicopter and the fire service were called at 00:30 to reports of concern for a man walking on the roofs of buildings in market square .
a 21-year-old man from cambridge was arrested and taken to parkside police station on sus of burglary .
0200hrs # cambridge suspect located on roof top who entered a premises .
officers attended and located suspect inside .

author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: man located walking on rooftops of cambridge shops
text: cambridge police , the force helicopter and cambridgeshire fire service have been in operation after a man was located on the rooftops of shops in cambridge .
details are sketchy at the moment but we 're trying to find out more information .
cambridge police
cambridgecops
multi-agency incident in cambridge this morning with @ twitterid @ twitterid - one in custody for burglary
multi-agency incident in cambridge this morning with @ twitterid @ twitterid - one in custody for burglary
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: man in court after police chase tractor to wisbech
text: a man arrested after a tractor was chased between two counties by six patrol cars and a force helicopter is appearing in court .
the vehicle was taken from a farm in tilney st lawrence , norfolk , on saturday before being abandoned in oakroyd crescent in wisbech during the evening .
a 25-year-old man from wisbech is due to appear via video link at norwich magistrates ' court charged with failing to stop , theft of a motor vehicle and driving without insurance .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: a16 to peterborough to get average speed checks after eight deaths
text: a road which has seen eight deaths and 15 serious injuries in its first five years is to get average speed cameras .
the a16 , in lincolnshire , was extended to peterborough in 2010 after years of campaigning , delays and a public inquiry .
the speed enforcement cameras will be installed on the stretch of road between spalding and crowland .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: weather : cloudy and cold
text: it will be a cloudy start , with patchy light rain in the west soon clearing to leave all areas dry .
a bright but cold afternoon with brief sunny spells possible .
maximum temperature : 3c ( 37.4f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : road remains closed due to floods
text: the a1101 wash road in welney remains closed in both directions between new bedford river and old bedford river due to flooding .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: headlines : summer punting touts could be banned air ambulance says new base 'fully operational '
text: here are the stories we 're looking at this morning :

BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: welcome to monday 's cambridgeshire live
text: good morning and welcome to cambridgeshire live .
we 'll have all the news , sport , travel and weather updates from now until 18:00 .
you can send your stories , and comments to us at any time via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News
